website_summaries.verdict: Multiple color options and a nonslip bottom designed for use on all floor surfaces highlight the features on this tough rubber doorstop that is built to last.
pros: The 4 color options match most home or office color schemes
The sloped design works on doors up to an impressive 1.3-inch gap, which covers all but the largest gaps
Nonslip bottom keeps the doorstop in place on smooth surfaces
cons: Like many doorstops, this model may not work as well in older buildings, where the door gaps tend to be larger

customer_reviews.title: Nice Door Jam
customer_reviews.text: Used two to make one excellent front door JAM. Needed protection front door kicking intruders. Combo problem of Door height over floor & slick wood floor. Solved by trimming contact cementing two trimmed door stops as shown. Thicker end must be on top. Result - runner jams door to help delay home break long enough to call 911 and prepare security. Finally solved this. Great product material
customer_reviews.author: B. Dutcher

customer_reviews.title: dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two packs thinking if I needed 2 for a door or so I would have plenty. My intention was for a little added security. not one of our doors...the ones they actually fit under... stayed put with moderate pushing in on the door. slid across the carpeted floors and the one door that needed two due to spaceing they just did not work at all. i will be returning the one unopened package. they would work to just prop open a door but they should be advertised this way. Not for security and safety.
customer_reviews.author: Donna S. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it seems weird to write a review for a door stop, but these work really well! Using them on LVP flooring with doors that are more than half an inch off the floor. Put them in place and forget about them. The little holder things are a really nice touch. I expect to keep the door stops in place most of the time, so I don't need them, but they are such a good idea, I'll probably install then anyway. All the way around, great product and good company. Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Axel Blickle

customer_reviews.title: Non-Conventional Use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use with my daiggter’s Communication device and they are amazing!! Her device must be at the perfect angle and these doorstops allo me to put them under the back and I can adjust the angle due to the varying degree of rise on the doorstops. The holder make it perfect to carry them right on the back of her device and the heavy-duty rubber keeps it from slipping!! Thanks for helping my daughter communicate!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect door stop
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice set of door stops. Great design, good looking, very nice gray color and works on all surfaces in my house (rugs, wood, tile). A nice feature is a little white holder that you can stick on the door or molding that holds the door stop when not in use. I mounted one at the bottom of the door and another on some molding behind a curtain. Nice way to not loose your door stop when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Phillips

customer_reviews.title: These don't work on hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: If you have hardwood floor and want to block intruders from accessing your room these don't work on hardwood floor. First of all they can be pushed aside with a pencil and second if there's any dust (lets be honest, dust is real) then they have zero "traction". I'll keep them just for casual use (to hold doors open LOL) but not for keeping my door from being opened. But they do come with cool sticky things where you can "stash" the door stopper when not in use (like behind a dresser or behind drapes. If I had a rug this may work well.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Door Stoppers
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. I bought them to use for the heavy door to my classroom and this holds the door back perfectly. I also love that I can store it on the back of the door when it's not in use so that the kids don't kick it around in the hallway.
customer_reviews.author: Lrdboneil

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. Need Hodor.
customer_reviews.text: These door stops are way too small to do anything. They really don't hold any doors open at all. My doors are very low to the ground and these still can't hold it open. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: WHO would have thought a door stop would make such a difference??
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS THING!!! Who would have thought I would (or anyone would) love a door stop?!?! Well, we (my place of business) do - we have large glass doors that are heavy and we have put buckets of paint, etc. in front of them to keep them open. NOT attractive - NO MORE!! These stops hold heavy doors, no more tripping over buckets that look so unsightly. the holder is a nice touch - we keep the door to our conference room open except during meetings - nice to know right where the holder is and it doesn't go skipping down the hall!
customer_reviews.author: DANA C.

customer_reviews.title: Door stoppers that do not stop a door.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these door stops for one simple reason, they did not hold my door in place! I would place these under the door and walk away, and the door would open, sliding these right across the carpet. I used them exactly as indicated in the instructions and they simply were unable to hold the door on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: frankfromnj

customer_reviews.title: We love these doorstopper
customer_reviews.text: We love these doorstopper. Sleek, good grip and easy enough for even my 3 year old to wedge in the door with no worries of it not being secure enough. Great product!! Also my ten year old uses one to keep her bedroom door closed when she is in their. Due to the house shifting her door won’t latch and her siblings would burst in. She has fake would laminate flooring so if I push hard enough I can move it a few inches then pull the door back towards me and it’ll be release the door stopper. The kids haven’t figured that out though and they can’t oush it open. Unintended purpose but that has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: I am actually excited about door stops...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. I had a door stop for my office that literally tore in half after using it for just a couple of weeks. This door stop is so sturdy and thick, but it works perfectly on all types of floors and keeps my door open without having to jam it under the door. The little holders are so convenient and cute. I love how you can stack these if you have a wider gap under your door too! Door stops are unfortunately not allowed in my workplace, so don't tell, and even when one gets confiscated, I have 2 more!! Awesome product, awesome value.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Almost became a hotel statistic
customer_reviews.text: Well. I recently returned from a trip and used it in my high-end hotel room. The door gap was small but I was still able to jam it in. I sat back to play a few hands of solitaire before bed when to my surprise I see someone push the stopper with their finger from outside my door. I called security and they handled the entire situation to my satisfaction. I’m going to keep them just to keep a couple of doors from closing at home on a windy day. Ladies - do not rely on this gadget for your personal safety. Use other alternatives. Sincerely, another woman that could have been another hotel statistic.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works great on carpet!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a door stopper to keep my dog out of the laundry room where I keep the cats' food (otherwise he'll eat it). I wasn't sure this would work, but when I saw you could put 2 together if needed I thought I would give them a try. I only need one and it keeps my door from swinging either way, so the cats can still get in, but the dog can't. Works great on my carpeted floor as well. I also like the holder they provide, so when I need to get in and out of the laundry room I can just store the stopper easily with the holder.
customer_reviews.author: charis29

customer_reviews.title: Skinny, slippery, and weak
customer_reviews.text: Well, they won't stop any door in our house in any room. I've tried them on doors over our carpeted floors, our tiled floors, our wood floors, and marble flows, and with one light shove, the doors all swung open with little or not resistance from these door "stops". The door stop either deformed and let the door push past their thin profile, or the door stop itself simply slid along with the door. It slid on carpet, it slid on marble, and it slid on wood. It stuck on rough tile but then compressed so much the door went over anyway. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Mutart

customer_reviews.title: Wow... they are good
customer_reviews.text: They worked like a charm.... dont know why I dint purchase them earlier, instead of being tortured by banging doors! Very sturdy, strong, flexible, keeps the door wedged very nicely. The holders are a nice idea, though I havent tried them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dhanashri

customer_reviews.title: Do exactly what they're supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to think of a way to rave about a door stopper, so I'll just say that these are awesome for what they are. I have heavy steel doors with spring-loaded hinges in my apartment and they haven't budged in the slightest during the two and a half months I've been using them, even in some of the heavy winds we've been seeing down here in Texas lately. The little clip to store them on the door is nice, too-unobtrusive and secure.Door stoppers aren't exactly the sort of thing you buy on a regular basis, but if I ever need more, I wouldn't hesitate to get more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with these door stoppers
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these door stoppers. Because of the shape, they are easy to wedge under the door, and hold in place. Much better than the solid kind. The holders are a great idea too! I have one stuck on the door frame just inside my laundry room. Perfect - always right there when I want it! I travel a lot, and am packing one to take with me as a security device in hotels.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline V

customer_reviews.title: Excited about a door stopper?
customer_reviews.text: So I will forgive you for wondering why I got excited about these door stoppers. Well, this is a company that truly cares about their product even though we may think of it as rather "unsexy". First, it is a well made, versatile and functional product at a reasonable price. But the company included a couple of extras, like a holder you can put on your baseboard to store the stopper and door hanger signage (like in a hotel) telling other you want the door to remain open. These folks care about their product. Buy from them.
customer_reviews.author: gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great door stop
customer_reviews.text: I must not have paid attention, but it comes with a holder...awesome! I am a teacher and need a good door stop. This one is great. Holds my heavy door, does the job.
customer_reviews.author: NogV

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grip tile, slides away
customer_reviews.text: I use this for security to keep my door closed at night. I've tested different placements by placing it and then trying to open the door. The best it has worked was that the door opened a few inches before getting stuck, but then you could still slowly push it all the way open. The worst it has worked was when I forgot it was there in the morning and opened the door normally, and it stopped around halfway open. It works worse and worse the more times it's used- it looks like it curves from being under the door and has less surface area on the floor. It might work on other surfaces, but it doesn't grip tile.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT HOLD FIRE DOOR
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold open the door between our garage and house, which is a heavy fire door. If I use two wedges (as demonstrated in product photos), get them in just the right spot, and really shove them in hard I can sometimes get them to hold, but that’s not very convenient when I’m just trying to get the groceries into the house. The one thing I do like is the wall storage system. It was easy to stick on the wall and the stoppers slide in and out easily. Our old stopper worked better for the door, but our puppy chewed it which is why I needed a new one I could store out of his reach.
customer_reviews.author: mulloyjen

customer_reviews.title: What an absolute waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I have tile flooring so maybe this is my problem, but the door stopper does NOTHING to stop the door from moving; it just slides along the floor with the door. There is a tool included that provides an option to double up on the stoppers for doors that have a little bit of height to them (the gap from the floor to the door). I even tried that method and that did not work either. Maybe this could work on a carpeted floor but I would not recommend this for any other type of flooring.
customer_reviews.author: litta015

customer_reviews.title: I want this to work so badly...
customer_reviews.text: I have a heavy front door in my building. I needed something to hold the door as I take my bike or shopping cart in and out of the building. I put one of these under the door and the door just went right through it. I put 2 of these back to back as shown in the direction, they filled in the door gap. However, they didn't hold the door long enough they slide slowly and gradually closing the door. I am still contemplating whether or not to keep this. I just wish they hold this annoying heavy door perfectly without sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Zee K

customer_reviews.title: Cool storage option
customer_reviews.text: I just put these up yesterday - so there isn't any long term data to go on yet. I did try them on the doors I was planning to use them with, and they seemed to grip quickly. I like the wall hangers that come with them - so my hope is that people will put them back in the wall holders when the door no longer needs to be open - rather than leave them slung around on the floor where puppies think they are a chew toy, or where people like me trip on them.
customer_reviews.author: seagreen

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive door stop
customer_reviews.text: I am in the process of moving and got tired of fighting the door that leads to our garage. It never stays open when you want it to. This stopper works great to prop the door open while going in and out with boxes, furniture, etc. It is also easy to nudge out of the way when you are ready to close the door. It is nice that 3 come to a pack, in case you need to double one up, depending on the gap space between the bottom of the door and where it meets the flooring.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Doorstop that doesn’t stop a door!
customer_reviews.text: Do not ignore this review!! I was fooled by all the positive reviews but these do not work! My door just slides closed on my new EVP flooring (waterproof laminate). An absolute waste of money! I can’t imagine that they would work on really any kind of flooring considering they are a very hard, slippery plastic, not like the old rubber ones that have a bit of sticky to them. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: joyflute

customer_reviews.title: These little guys really work!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an old house with very heavy solid wood doors. The door going from the kitchen to the dining room is a swinging door that looks great but can be a pain when having a formal dinner. I have ceramic tile on the kitchen floor and have tried many different door stoppers with mixed results. Usually need a door stopper & a brick to hold the door open. These little guys really work! Holds the ten foot swinging door without any slippage. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lianne S. Greve

customer_reviews.title: Portable Safety
customer_reviews.text: I housesit/dogsit regularly and one of my most regular clients had their car broken into and a house key stolen, it's pretty close to impossible to break in with these around so it gives me good peace of mind to have them with me. I can't speak for the sticky pad that comes with it since I've only used these in other houses but they're pretty easy to pack and with doors that are too tall you can wedge two together. Thank you for giving peace of mind to me and the dogs I watch!
customer_reviews.author: Average Jill

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: These look good BUT they are too short for a door with any kind of gap under it. I was able to use it for one door.....had to attach the other two together to achieve any kind of height to actually stop the other door. Who knew that door stops had sizes....not me....learn something new every day.
customer_reviews.author: itsasteel

customer_reviews.title: Provides an additional layer of safety while traveling
customer_reviews.text: A really wonderful product and highly useful !! Years ago, I found one of these little gems. I was traveling by myself and often stayed in sketchy places. I used the door stopper on the inside of my hotel room and felt so much more secure. Thru the years, there were a few instances of someone trying my door. The stopper held firm. I sent some with my daughter for college life and now that she travels with her job, we just keep one in every suitcase or travel bag we use. They are small and for the price, provide a great deal of security.
customer_reviews.author: USCmom427

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: So this is an awesome product and the customer service is unexpected and wonderful. These aren't the tallest door stops and actually didn't work on my doors at all as they are meant to be used. HOWEVER of you place 2 together and adhere the flat parts to each other it still makes a great door stop. The rubber still is effective and stays firmly in place. So if you have tall door gaps these still are a great solution
customer_reviews.author: Jada

customer_reviews.title: They do the job and look decent
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these because my cat accidentally locked herself in my bedroom during my 12 hr shift at work and unsurprising peed on my bed ( a giant thank you to whoever invented the waterproof mattress pad and the customers who bought out the regular mattress pad forcing me to get the waterproof one when I bought my new mattress). I was expecting them to be a little taller but there is only one door that has a larger gap and these only just stop the door but otherwise they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Pink_Elephant_Circus

customer_reviews.title: Worth the by if you need a door stop
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 3 pack. Use it for the doors that always swing shut especially the garage door so it holds it open whil we bring in groceries. The product is durable, sturdy, and cost efficient. It comes will door stop holder so when its not in use you can place it in the holder which is neatly located on the door. It works on carpet and hardwood easy to work. I like the look of it and the product looks well made. Easy to clean if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Something that really is a plus for workplaces
customer_reviews.text: "Now this was the best surprise of all - I thought I got a door stopper what I got was a door stopper with a holder so that it is not kicked around and displaced and stolen. The holder fits on the bottom of the door and holds the stopper how great is that AND and it looks great and works great. What an idea!" AND it holds up looking great after use. Cannot beat this one...in any office or anywhere you might need it and it never ever gets lost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully designed, Useful, Works efficiently
customer_reviews.text: Product is good. Works great on flat, even, clean floor surfaces. The stick on holder is genius so that you can have a storage place when not in use and great for keeping it off the floor and making sure it doesn't get lost. The seller is great, considerate and wants the customer to be happy. The package even came with door hangers that are interchangeable saying to leave door OPEN or CLOSED. This was a great little touch and adds great value to the overall product and ordering experience.
customer_reviews.author: K M Dello

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work well if you have hardwood or tile floors.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and a good look to them. Biggest issue is that if you have hardwood floors, the gap between the bottom of the door and the floor is larger and if you use these type of doorstops, the door just goes right over them. Only worked on 1 of my 3 doors in my household. Disappointed but at least 1 worked.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Product as described
customer_reviews.text: On hardwood floors I have to really push hard on the Stop to make them stay but they prevent my robot vac from pushing the door closed and getting trapped in bedroom or bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not stop door from opening.
customer_reviews.text: We tried these on tile, carpet, wood floors...they did not keep the door from opening at all...Key word in the description is DECORATIVE...will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ann W.Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work in bedroom on carpet or front door on tile. I tried everything to get it to work with NO success.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Twain

customer_reviews.title: Great holder stow the wedge when not in use
customer_reviews.text: This rubbery wedge is great at stopping my doors from slamming when it's windy outside. The shape & the rubbery material adjusts well to the gap between the bottom of the door and the floor. I especially like the stick-on holder to stow the wedge when not in use. No more floating wedge that gets kicked around!
customer_reviews.author: Helen L.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: These come in handy and are a life saver! I have two doors to get through when I come home through the garage. I like to prop these doors open when we come home with groceries. Easy to use and have no issues with doors staying open.
customer_reviews.author: Kara LaMarca

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LOOK, GOOD VALUE
customer_reviews.text: Needed non-marring stops for several hardwood doors. Took a chance on this unique design. I'm delighted. A great feature is the small holder to put on the back side of a door so the stop is always handy. If your door clearance is more than about an inch (like my garage side door), then you will need to add a wood block to raise the base height. The stop doesn't slide on the block and the door stays where it is supposed to even in a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: SRdto

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I just put these underneath my door and they are awesome, I had to stack them since my door is high off the floor, but they did exactly what the description said it would do, that you can stack them to put under high door's, wonderful! They are well built, keep the door from moving, and have a little storage place for you to hang them when not in use, I'm extremely happy with these, definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gove

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Theses work but not well with a door that sits up high from the floor. I bought a pack of 3 but only 1 worked well. We have slot of windows and I always have them open so I need these to keep doors from slamming
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Blair

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this for my front door. There is a bit of a gap between the door and the floor. I followed directions stating to connect two stoppers together, and it still didn't work. The adhesion or grip to the floor as advertise is false. I open the door and it glides through the floor instead of stopping. What is the point? Total waste.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Shylin

customer_reviews.title: Only doorstop you need
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as I needed something to block a door on carpet and these work perfect. I did not have to even double stack but that works also. They have a good thickness to them and bendable but sturdy. Have not used on anything but carpet but if they stay in place there I'm confident they would with no issue on wood or tile.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Useless on carpet, disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They doorstops seem nicely made and packaged, but they seem useless on carpet. I single- and double-stacked them under my bedroom door, but when I pull the door toward me, the doorstops simply slide along the carpet with minimal resistance. The flat surface on the underside of the doorstops has no texture and doesn't grip the carpet. Maybe they would grip a hard surface, but they do nothing on my carpet. They might keep a pet cat out, but anything that wants to get in would easily push the door in. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: nobody

customer_reviews.title: Multi-Function Doorstop
customer_reviews.text: I have a non-verbal daughter with Rett Syndrome that uses a communication device called a Tobii which uses eye gaze technology to enable her to talk with us. Correct positioning of her Tobii is critical for her to be able to use her device properly and when Susan Norwell (educator/Rett University co-founder) used these doorstops to help get it in position I knew I had to have a set of my own. They are easy to use, help stabilize her device, and are easy to carry in her bag. I tell others about them all the time!
customer_reviews.author: RettMomFL

customer_reviews.title: Verify door spacing height before ordering
customer_reviews.text: Product as appeared, three stars because it is too short for most of the interior household doors where I wanted to use it. Make sure to double check your door height before ordering. I am using one of them. While it holds primary door I wanted it for, on carpet, it also allows me to close the door without moving the door stop. I go right over it. So that's easy!
customer_reviews.author: Stern

customer_reviews.title: Great:  Quality rubber; stackable; No odor.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my daughter to toss in her book bag in case of an active school shooter. One is great for most doors and they can be stacked for doors with higher clearance. They are made of a high-quality rubber with little to no odor (says a very sensitive nose). They are extremely light, so they don’t add extra weight to her book bag. It’s a cheap, simple, and effective way to keep an inward-opening door closed.
customer_reviews.author: Balanced Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product 5 stars because of the excellent customer service I got from the company. I bought these not realizing the space between the floor and the bottom of the doors is too large for the door stop to work. The doors just pass right over the stops. However, they look sturdy and I'm sure they would work well in a house with doors that almost meet the floor (ours is a very old farmhouse). When I contacted the company to return them, they were great. Quick response to my inquiry and just fantastic. I'll be buying more of their products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ali G

customer_reviews.title: Not for securing a door, but maybe for holding one open.
customer_reviews.text: These doorstops are incredibly thin, 1 inch. I tried it on several doors at my home and work and it is way too thin to keep the doors shut. The stoppers are also not very grippy-- easily sliding away on both tile and carpet. If you put two of them together, it almost works ok. I wouldn't purchase this again, the standard cheap brown door wedges they have at the hardware store do a much better job.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D. Gicewicz

customer_reviews.title: Love this door stop
customer_reviews.text: So I didn't expect to love this product because of the negative reviews, I always read those first. But I love it! My door is too tall but luckily this company sends emails with "how-to" information on it! So I stacked them up and it worked great. I have tile floor and I pull the door while pushing the door stop like the directions said. I also love the door stop holders they are so convenient! I put them up high because I have a fractured back and bending over is difficult. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Icey87

customer_reviews.title: My sister must be super strong! Doors still push open.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my sister for when she stays in hotels and for her apartment. She reports that they slide on carpet, wood and vinyl. She has doubled them, turned them upside down and wedged them in various lengths of the doors, and she can still open the doors. By the way, she isn't that strong.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to work so bad! My daughters are 2 and 1 and are fascinated with closing doors right now. I’m scared one of them is going to get their fingers shut in the door. The gap under my doors (even the front door) was too high for these to fit properly, so I followed the directions and used two of them put together. They did not hold the door at all so they were pretty much useless. Very disappointed. Too much hassle to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I like fresh air...
customer_reviews.text: I like to keep the doors partially opened so the dogs can go in and out easily and to provide some fresh air in the house. I don't like them to be completely open as too many bugs, etc. These have a handy feature where they can be hung on the door so they don't get kicked around or in the way when not in use. Great idea!
customer_reviews.author: Linda G

customer_reviews.title: Works Okay
customer_reviews.text: I use this on carpet to hold a door in place for my cats (I have a small random closet that I turned into their "litter room") however it just slides on the carpet and doesn't take much force to move it. I will call out that I do NOT use the adhesive piece as I'm constantly moving it to go clean out the litter box, so this could potentially work better if I did.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Gores

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: So far the door stoppers have been everything we thought they would be. Very sturdy with nice gripping, so you don't have to worry if they will withstand a strong force. The extra addition of pockets gives a nice touch for easy storage. Nice size that's perfect to fit under the size of your door. I can't really think of any downside to the function and use of this product. Highly recommend it if you are looking for a clean and functional door stopper. Also, customer service has been a plus. Can't go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: great door stopper and holder - modern and inconspicuous
customer_reviews.text: i love these - all of the doors in our house have to be propped open and these work great for that job without calling attention to themselves. they also come with a holder that i wasn't expecting but have really enjoyed having. they stick to the back of the door inconspicuously and hold the stopper when not in-use. no complaints with any of the door stoppers or any of the holders.
customer_reviews.author: HolmesLyall

customer_reviews.title: I love the holder
customer_reviews.text: I use the Wundermax door stopper to prop doors open at work to increase air circulation to combat COVID-19.They are sturdy and perfect for doors that have a small space between them and the floor I also love the holder which is great to put on a cabinet or cart.
customer_reviews.author: mayorange

customer_reviews.title: Great stoppers!
customer_reviews.text: They are well build and will not damage your doors. The holder is great, it came with 3M adhesive, so just stick the holder on the wall behind the door and you will never lose the stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I know they address this in the product description, ...
customer_reviews.text: I know they address this in the product description, but these things are too short for all of my doors. If you need to use two of these stacked on top of each other for basic functionality, you should probably redesign the product.
customer_reviews.author: beedle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Doorstop
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome doorstops. They can be stacked for doors where bottom is higher. They even came w storage device to stick on door & signs that hang on door knob saying to keep door open. My AC system works best w all doors open. Used these doorstops for 2 doors upstairs that kept closing.
customer_reviews.author: JeffreyB

customer_reviews.title: Does not stop heavy classroom door
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher and I bought this item to prop my classroom door open. It does not work for heavy doors. I would not recommend this item for school use.
customer_reviews.author: LShia

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: You never really think about door stoppers until you really need one. I really needed three, for three very different places, so I was glad to find a 3 pack of what appear to be well-engineered stops. I can say that these stops exceeded my expectations and I don't foresee them wearing out. As a bonus, they come with a cool little holder for each stop; now I can "put them up" and no longer have to worry about the cleaning crew accidentally throwing them out. I'll be buying more of these for other doors!
customer_reviews.author: Honeybee22274

customer_reviews.title: Great for classrooms
customer_reviews.text: I love this door stopper. My classroom door is heavy and this door stopper was able to keep it open. The cheap door stopper I originally had could not keep the door open for the life of it. I love the holder it comes with too. When there are 100 kids walking in and out of my room, my door stopper usually ends up in the oddest place!
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a period of time
customer_reviews.text: These worked really well on our hardwood floors, until they started to get a little dirty, now they are slick and don’t keep our doors in place unless they are aggressively kicked under the door. I have tried to clean them, but they have lost the “tackyness” or “grip” they initially had.
customer_reviews.author: spaghetti321

customer_reviews.title: Finally  a stopper that works
customer_reviews.text: For many month we tried with other stoppers. I finally had it and ordered these. They are awesome. Due to the fact that the rubber compresses under the door the upward force is large enough to hold the door. Great design. Happy to have them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Werner

customer_reviews.title: Not effective
customer_reviews.text: We bought these doorstops to put at the base of the hotel room door for extra safety. Before traveling, I tested it out at home both on a tile floor as well as a carpeted floor. The doorstop didn’t prevent the door from opening on either surfaces. The doorstop is very thin and light so they are not effective for keeping a door from opening.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher/Mom

customer_reviews.title: Super Strong Grip
customer_reviews.text: With an older home and uneven doorways, we need good doorstops to keep doors from slamming shut in a breeze. I tried a few different brands, and this is the best by far. It's solid, stays put, and keeps any door from moving. It also works as an added safety measure if you're traveling alone. Excellent product, I think these will last forever. The manufacturer is a pleasure to do business with, too..
customer_reviews.author: natty buncho

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs got rambunctious and destroyed the locking mechanism on our French Doors during a mad chase. Since the doors are quite old, finding a replacement has been very difficult. We started using door stoppers to keep 1/2 in place. Forget it. It moved every time we opened or shut the other 1/2 of the door. Every other door stop has been a failure. They move and shift easily.. Wundermax hasn't moved. It stays where we put it and keeps that 1/2 of the door closed. We no longer have to pack 5 or 6 door stops underneath. The only disadvantage is that our dog, Reggie, loves to chew on it. Glad it came in a pack of 3!
customer_reviews.author: Ilene S

customer_reviews.title: What were they thinking?!
customer_reviews.text: It’s just not high enough to make contact with the bottom of the door so the door swings over it. Note in the picture the dark brown wedge is from Walmart. You would think they would have used that for comparison. Our doors are in an architect designed building so they are pretty standard.
customer_reviews.author: UK2CA2SD

customer_reviews.title: Good looks but bot as effect
customer_reviews.text: Well these are nice and modern looking, they are not as effective as the big commercial type black ones. Unfortunately, because the are more thinner and the rubber material is very pliable, it’s quite easy to push a door right over it without too much effort.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, I love how they have the adhesive to put on the door. I’m a teacher with a door that closes on it’s own so this stopper was a blessing. The people who sent the product kept I. Touch with me, before it arrived and and after. I like when shippers follow their products and make sure the customers are satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great as a Speaker Stand for Desktop
customer_reviews.text: This are also perfect speaker stands for your desktop. The soft rubber securely holds the speaker in place, angles the speaker up for better imagining, and decouples the speaker from resonating on your desktop. Really improves the sound if you use small speakers on a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Hogarth

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars For Support not Item!
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for me because it just slid with no resistant across any floor/door combo I used it on, but the manufacturer gave me a full refund without having to send it through the mailing system during these times so much obliged.
customer_reviews.author: Zack B.

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for any of ours doors around the house. Way too short. It appears it’s well built but just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We use these at home for several of our doors that tend to drift close on their own. Great price and good height for doors with up to a 1 inch gap between the floor and bottom. The rubber seems to grip fine without having to use any adhesive on wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: always curious

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get excited by a door stop and I don't write many reviews but this is a good product. It grips most any surface and does not mar the floor or door. We've even installed one of the holders that accompany the 3 door stops and it adheres easily and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Flip Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Do not use on large gaps
customer_reviews.text: Too short for our doors. The manufacturer suggestion is to double up when the door needs the extra height. However, it is not as effective. Instead, I added a furniture pad under each to raise it to the door. This is better, but the manufacturer should not offer this as an all height door stopper. It only fits narrow gaps.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Best Door Stops ever.
customer_reviews.text: The best door stops I have ever used. They hold on the slipperest of floors thru wind gales. Love the storage pocket that keeps it close and handy and stuck to the door so you never lose it. Thank you for a door stop that truly works like a door stop.
customer_reviews.author: foxvalley

customer_reviews.title: Great for larger doors, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: During Covid19, we still have to work. At certain times of the day, we are bringing in tools on carts for calibration and then returning to warehouse. Our doors to testing area at the larger 10ft, metal doors. These door stoppers hold the doors open well. The come with an adhesive backed “shoe” we mounted on the wall beside the light switches so we can easily store them when we aren’t using. This was great alternative to removing doors from the hinges as the office area is using HVAC and the warehouse is not.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda E.

customer_reviews.title: These are cute and...a-door-able
customer_reviews.text: I don't really put things in my door but I had to get these to keep this door slightly...a-jar. I just need to keep this door at exactly the point I want...must be open to new things 🥁 [Bah Dum Tiss] ;-D
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: these do not work on my door because the side of my door is too high for them. But the stoppers are rubber and I’m sure they would work very well on a door that they sit under. I would recommend them for smaller openings under the door
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and love the included “storage” tip. Place the white tip on the back of your door and you can store the stopper out of sight when not in use. Cute little cardboard door hangers to place on your door to “keep open” or “ keep closed”. Nice touch. Love that depending on the space you can stack the stoppers together too!
customer_reviews.author: JClark

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution
customer_reviews.text: Our small pediatric practice has two patient entries and in an effort to keep little hands off the doorknobs we propped them open during patient care hours because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Items we found around the office presented a tripping hazard, got stuck on stroller wheels or just slid out of place. These door stops work well and the holders keep them from getting misplaced.
customer_reviews.author: Marcella F Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: While the product is a clever design and seems sturdy I could not get them to work on our hardwood floors. I gave them a 1 star rating because I can't use them for the intended purpose. Tried doubling them and kicking them under the door to be secure but they just slid on the floors when the door was opened, albeit with a slight drag. I wanted to use them for security but they definitely won't work for me for that. Maybe just to keep a door open. Would have returned them but missed the return deadline....oh well, they weren't that expensive. Wish they had worked.
customer_reviews.author: Janet C. Emard

customer_reviews.title: Works as you’d expect
customer_reviews.text: Works as a doorstop, some floors better than others. I used them as just a touch of extra security traveling mostly on my own. It does the job and would buy a little time, but doesn’t truly hold the door shut. If I give just one good push they do open at least a few inches. But they do hold the doors open well, I think better than keeping it shut.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa E

customer_reviews.title: Good for propping open regular lightweight doors!
customer_reviews.text: Works to hold open a normal inside door. You can put 2 together if your gap is large and that actually works. The little holder to stick on your door is a cool addition. Ultimately I returned because I had bought them for a heavy outside door, which they did not hold open. Maybe the angle and weight combined, not sure. They’re really just for propping open light weight doors!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Door stop didn’t work. Tried it on both carpet and hardwood floors. The door pushes right over the top of the door stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Jemini W.

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: I use these to stable my telescope. I should have bought these sooner. They are better than anything I have tried before. I can't explain why they work better than wood shims but they do. Maybe the wood is not as tacky
customer_reviews.author: opieatc40

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews to find a door stop for my swinging pantry door, I was pretty convinced nothing was going to hold this door on my wood floors. This door stop works perfect. It doesn’t slide on the wood floors and holds the door exactly like a door stop should.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! Such a simple thing, but they work so well. I read so many great reviews on Amazon that I ordered two packs on a Saturday and they were in my mail box on Sunday (the next day!) We tend to get some really gusty winds in Sonoma County and these are holding my doors nice and secure. I also plan to use them when I stay in hotels, as some other customers mentioned. Couldn't be more pleased - they're perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. CCS

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I've used both wood, metal and hard plastic door stops in the past. These are made of a pliable plastic and are far superior to any doorstop I've previously owned. I'm using them on both a wood floor and a marble tile floor. These door stops are engineered to deform slightly so they'll compress, slip under the door then expand to secure the door tightly. They are easy to insert and remove and have superior grip on the floor compared to anything I've used before. Well worth the minimal cost, will buy again
customer_reviews.author: DickieCoon

customer_reviews.title: Great door stopper with holder!
customer_reviews.text: These door stoppers are great! I love that the door hangers provide a continent spot for them to stay where I need, and not have to worry about it getting kicked around, tripped over or lost. I have mine adhered on the back of my door near the floor, it’s hardly noticeable & sticks great! I’m glad I can finally keep my door in place without having to stack other heavier items in front which often posed a risk for tripping! It amazing with how light the product is!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Holds a heavy metal door
customer_reviews.text: I use this door stop at work. It's used for a large heavy metal fireproof door with a thin commerical carpet floor. This door stop works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Cricketroo

customer_reviews.title: No grip, slides a lot
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a security device to keep a door closed. They have no grip and slide all over the place. I tried putting a anti-slip mat underneath and they still will allow the door to open with any force at all. I tried using all three at once and still didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: College Student

customer_reviews.title: Best door stopper there is
customer_reviews.text: Ive tried door stoppers from all the big box stores and none worked that great....either slipped or werent big enough for a door with a big gap....these you can put on top of each other for doors with a big gap,they also dont slide on wood or tile floors. As a bonus they have a holder you can stick anywhere to store the door stopper when your not using it..These work!!
customer_reviews.author: Quenbach

customer_reviews.title: Effective, but have to have hands free to place under a large gap.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the garage door, but the gap between the door and the floor is large. Since this came with multiple door stops, I was able to stack them as advertised and it holds the heavy door open nicely. I gave 4 stars because in order to stack them I have to wedge it under using my hands compared to the convenience of sliding it under with my foot. Once placed, it sticks well on the tile, effectively does the job, and was a good price. It just would have been nice to be able to use my foot to slide it under to hold the door open when my hands are full.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Flores

product_meta.title: Wundermax Door Stopper Rubber Door Stop Wedge Security Door Stops With Door Holder Rubber Door Stoppers Works On All Floor Types and Carpet Heavy Duty Door Jam (3 Pack Gray)
feature_bullets: PREMIUM QUALITY RUBBER: Your new Door Stoppers are made of REACH certified odorless rubber. They have been rigorously tested and approved by SGS to prove they are safe to use.
BEST VALUE PACK: Your set comes with three free holder hooks to hang the product on any door and keep them safe and organized. Its colorful gift package makes it an original and thoughtful gift.

WEDGES DOORS LIKE NO OTHER: Our unique sloped design and anti-slip base provide ultimate gripping power and allow your door stoppers to work on EVERY FLOOR surface. Furthermore, they can hold even the heaviest doors.
THE IDEAL SIZE: Your new door stoppers measure L 4.8" x W 1.6" x H 1". They will fit under any of your doors hanging anywhere from 0.1 to 1 inch off the floor.

LOVE IT OR LEAVE IT: Wundermax is committed to provide only the highest quality products and the best customer service. If at any time during the lifetime of our product you feel unsatisfied with your door stoppers for ANY reason, we will happily refund every penny of your order. And keep the door stoppers as our gift to you!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,508 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
